metadata.title: CVE-2017-6949 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in CHICKEN Scheme through 4.12.0. When using anonstandard CHICKEN-specific extension to allocate an SRFI-4 vector inunmanaged memory, the vector size would be used in unsanitised form as anargument to malloc(). With an unexpected size, the impact may have been asegfault or buffer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6949` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chicken-bin - 4.12.0-0.3
libchicken11 - 4.12.0-0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chicken package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.12.0-0.3').
